#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk authconfig
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: authconfig bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The authconfig packages contain a command line utility and a GUI application that can configure a workstation to be a client for certain network user information and authentication schemes and other user information and authentication related options. This update fixes the following bugs: The authconfig manual page has been updated with information on conditions for successful starting and enabling of the sssd service. (BZ#1072395) This update fixes the warning message displayed when attempting to use authconfig with the samba-windbind package not installed on the system to mention the correct package name. (BZ#1084997) Prior to this update, the authconfig utility overwrote all the LDAP base settings in the nslcd.conf file if there were multiple specific LDAP bases set. With this update, authconfig ignores the specific LDAP bases and reads and overwrites only the general LDAP base value. (BZ#1087733) This update adds a dependency on the policycoreutils package to authconfig. (BZ#1094297) Previously, when attempting to add an incorrectly formed IPv6 URI to the /etc/openldap/ldap.conf file, authconfig displayed a warning message, removed the malformed URI but did not update the file with the new URI. This behavior has been modified, and now it is possible to add an incorrect IPv6 URI to /etc/openldap/ldap.conf. (BZ#1111081) With this update, authconfig has been modified to keep altfile specification entries in the /etc/nsswitch.conf file. (BZ#1134084) In some cases the authconfig utility was not able to properly detect whether SSSD or Winbind should be enabled. As a consequence, these daemons were stopped when authconfig was run although they should not have been effected. With this update, authconfig no longer changes the state nor restarts the services whose configuration is not changed. (BZ#1134458) Previously, the ipa-client-install command used for the IPAv2 domain join was interactively asking for input. When called from the authconfig-gtk GUI, the user could not interact with it, and thus the domain join operation failed. With this update, the authconfig GUI uses the "ipa-client-install --unattended" command, so it no longer tries to interact with the user. As a result, the IPAv2 domain join operation can now successfully complete. (BZ#1134474) Prior to this update, it was not possible to specify multiple LDAP servers with the authconfig command. This bug has been fixed, and multiple LDAP servers can now be specified as expected. (BZ#1142830) Users of authconfig are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
